name: HexBug
description: A Discord bot for Hex Casting, with commands to search/display patterns, generate numbers, and more. If you're doing something Hex-related in Python, this has a lot of useful classes and methods that you can (and probably should) use.

name: Hex Studio
description: WIP visual editor and stack simulator for writing hexes in a similar manner to using the actual mod.

name: hex-interpreter
description: CLI tool for parsing and displaying patterns. A modified version of its rendering code is used in HexBug.

name: Hex-Casting-Generator
description: Very useful GUI tool for generating and displaying number literals.

name: hexdecode
description: CLI tool for decoding pattern lists. HexBug's core functionality is based on this. Mostly superseded by HexBug.

name: vscode-hex-casting
description: VSCode language features to make writing hexes easier, including highlighting, autocomplete, hover text, macro support, and more.

name: hexnumgen
description: Hex-Casting-Generator's number generation functionality, ported to Rust. Contains a CLI tool for generating number literals, and can also be used as a Rust library or a Python package. Used in HexBug.

name: Hexagon
description: A programming language for Hex Casting. Hexagon is a superset of the hexpattern format, adding variables, if statements, and more.

name: HexDrawAssist
description: An accessibility script for people who have trouble holding down their mouse button when drawing patterns. Requires AutoHotKey v2.

name: hexdoc
description: Python web book docgen for Patchouli and Hex Casting.

name: HexDummy
description: Bare-bones template for starting a multiloader Hex Casting addon

name: HexCC
description: A C inspired language that compiles down to Hex
